Declaring innocence, she turns to X-Force to help prove that it was her sister Maria (Feral) who actually committed the murders. They lure Feral to the old home of the Callasantos family in hopes of finally getting some answers.

Synopsis

Detective José Hidalgo has tracked murder suspect Lucia Callasantos [the mutant called Thornn] into the Morlock Tunnels, accompanied by the NYPD's superhuman task force "Code: Blue". She attacks them, fighting bravely, but she is outnumbered... shot with a tranquiliser dart, she protests her innocence--"I didn' kill my family!! SHE did!!"... As Code: Blue takes her away, Hidalgo is troubled--it seems he knew Thornn in happier times, and her mysterious accusation has a meaning for him...

Meanwhile, Domino is showing X-Force their new HQ, formerly Arcade's "Murderworld"--Cannonball is not impressed, but a good case is made and he comes around to the idea. Boomer gets goofy... Domino is rude to Boomer, sotto voce... Rictor is rude to Shatterstar amiably... Boomer drapes herself on Cannonball's arm... Cable is off somewhere... general conviviality.

In the Bronx a mob gathers, led by the anti-mutant group "Friends of Humanity"; they want to know the identity of the suspected murderer. As Hidalgo questions Thornn it comes out that these two knew each other as children, before Thornn's mutation, and her mother, brother and sister's murders. In fact--he loved her. He tries to speak to her about all of this, but she doesn't feel like talking. She asks for her phonecall, but Hidalgo doubts whether any lawyer in the city will be able to save her...

Outside, the mob is getting ugly... Graydon Creed [founder of the Friends of Humanity] is pleased... Thornn's name and picture are released, leaving no doubt that she is a mutant... Feral overhears this on a TV in a shop window. In Westchester the Beast asks Professor X if the X-Men should get involved--he says not; Cable has already called him. The media wonders if there is a link between X-Force and the murders...

Cable tells X-Force they have a responsibility to do something, as Feral was once a member of the team. Feral and Thornn are sisters. Cannonball gets cross--he thinks Thornn should stand trial, but Warpath reminds him that anti-mutant prejudice may have already condemned her. Cannonball is unconvinced; he remembers how Feral attacked him, and thinks her sister may be no different. But Cable wants to investigate.

The next morning Cable and Cannonball visit Thornn; the protest continues outside. Cable reveals that he is a qualified lawyer, and that Thornn's phonecall had been to him. Thornn is restrained in some kind of high-tech enormous handcuffs, but she is defiant. She says again that she is innocent. Cannonball still seems cross. Cable reveals he has heard that Feral is back in Manhattan, and asks Thornn why that might be. Thornn is enigmatic, evasive. Later, Cable talks to Hidalgo--he knows the detective thinks Thornn is not the killer, and offers (off the record) to help him catch Feral...

Due to the protests, Thornn is being transferred to Ryker's Island... however, the drivers are to be agents of the Friends of Humanity, and it has been arranged that Thornn will be 'killed while attempting to escape'. But Cable knew. Rictor and Shatterstar attack the prison van on motorcycles. The rest of X-Force are following in a futuristic car/tank type vehicle. Cannonball still out of sorts! Rictor attacks the van with a "low-level vibe-quake"; it loses control, and Warpath brings it to a stop. Hidalgo and Thornn are freed, and join X-Force in their vehicle, bound for an unknown destination...

On the way, Thornn's restraints are removed--Cable tells her they are going to see the one person who can help them learn the truth. Thornn is... horrified? Frightened? She speaks to herself in spanish.

They arrive at the building where Hidalgo, Thornn and Feral grew up. It's boarded up, abandoned--but Cable says, if their contact did her job right, "there should be one person here."... "YOU--?!" screams Thornn--Feral is above them, grinning/snarling... "Me, sister. Feral is here. Tricked into comin' here. Set up by you." She says she hates them all, and that if they want to know the truth they will have to tear it out of her...
name: Holding On

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Feral and Thornn's past are brought to light as X-Force and the sisters track through the old house in the Bronx. The sisters show how they became hardened and just who exactly is responsible for the deaths of each member of their family.
name: The Fun House: A Tale of Deception and Death

description: Warpath learns the Hellfire Club was not responsible for the butchering of his people. He also has a candid talk with Emma Frost about his motives for staying with X-Force. Meanwhile, Siryn talks about her feelings for Warpath with her father, Banshee.
name: A Lie of the Mind

description: Running Cerebro and Cable's Time Chamber simultaneously, Cannonball locates Sunspot. Oddly enough, Locus appears and teleports X-Force away in order to stop Sunspot from doing something awful. X-Force arrives at the MLF camp to find that Sunspot has supposedly been around all along as the terrorist Reignfire. The finding comes to late, as reality is ripped apart and the Age of Apocalypse begins.
name: Teapot in a Tempest

description: X-Force is beginning a new era. First off, Sunspot's powers are enhanced and he can fly. Cannonball graduates to the X-Men. Rictor leaves and Caliban joins. And Siryn is committed? Cable vows the future looks bright, but all this change is going to take some getting used to.
name: ...Already in Progress...

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: With X-Force in the X-Mansion, it doesn't take too long for Caliban to attack Sabretooth. Before the death-blow can be struck against the newly docile bad guy, Cable shows up and diffuses the situation. Boomer is chastised when it's found that she's been seeing Sabretooth regularly. Later, Beast has found some oddities with Shatterstar and conducts further tests while Cable and the rest of the boys head to Siberia to find out what happened to one of Xavier's underground outposts. The Mimic happened.
name: Under One Roof

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: So far, nothing is going right for the members of X-Force. For starters, Boomer is still visiting Sabretooth, as well as receiving unwanted advice, the latest coming from Wolverine. Then, Cable's team in Siberia severely mishandles the Mimic to the point that end up with no answers. Lastly, Siryn is undercover, but her mission is long over and there is still no one to bust her out.
name: Behind Closed Doors

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
All is not as it seems at the Weisman Institute for the Criminally Insane, as Deadpool and Siryn can attest! X-Force is scattered left and right, as confusing leads lead to more dead ends. Who is Jeremy Stevens? What are his plans for X-Force’s heaviest hitters?

Deadpool helps bust Siryn out of the Weisman Institute, but the doctor has other plans. Siryn is let go, but Deadpool is committed. Boomer continues to visit Sabretooth and Sunspot spouts some Askani.
name: Breakout

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: X-Force had had enough of Boomer's moonlighting to the Danger Room to visit Sabretooth. They stage an intervention in hopes of helping her see how dangerous the activity is. Boomer, however, is belligerent. The team threatens to kick her off the team when Professor X steps in and convinces her of her error. Elsewhere, Sebastian Shaw makes an alliance with Holocaust.
name: Intervention

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Sebastian Shaw has returned and has made a new ally: Holocaust. Together, they hunt down an X-Force team trying to enjoy some downtime.
name: Target: X-Force

description: Sebastian Shaw has Tessa (Sage) brainwash the whole team to hunt and kill Cable, who is with Domino trying to find the team. Cable takes on the whole team in a couple battles. Shatterstar stabs Domino. Cable fills the team with memories and they snap out of it.
name: Target: Cable

description: It has been an odd night. Sunspot continues to delve into Askani culture. Cable is stuck trying to convince Bishop that Boomer didn't release Sabretooth. Siryn has a nightmare about a captured Deadpool. Warpath is called to the middle of nowhere for a stranger named Risque to kiss him and then leave. The most fantastic, however, is Boomer's transformation into Meltdown. New hair and a new attitude promises to make things interesting for X-Force.
name: Reflections in the Night

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: At the mansion, Shatterstar questions his abilities when he loses to Warpath. Domino, Meltdown, and Siryn confront the Blob and see a few more clues about Onslaught. Sunspot and Caliban witness the death of the External Gideon.
name: Bad Girls

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Gideon, the External, is dead. Absalom and Crule think Caliban and Sunspot are responsible. The result: full-on assault. X-Force joins the fray, but only Warpath is able to learn the truth about the death of Gideon. Unfortunately, he is left in no condition to reveal what he knows.
name: Even an X-Ternal Can Die!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
X-Force is taken in and questioned by the NYPD. They tell of killing of the Externals by the mutant Selene. They are eventually freed.

Note: Several characters only appear in flashbacks.
name: Q & A

description: While springing Deadpool from the Weisman Institute, Siryn is plagued by visions of the man she’s trying to rescue. Shatterstar makes a full recovery, while Risque and Warpath explore a burgeoning romance. Can it be that Deadpool belongs in an asylum for the criminally insane? By the end of this issue, you’ll have your answer!
name: Crazy for You

description: Guest-starring X-Man! X-Force attempts to prevent Sinister from using Nate Grey for genetic experimentation. It’s Sinister vs. X-Force, with both sides vs. Onslaught! A dizzying battle will ensue!
name: Onslaught Impact 1: In the Company of Strangers, Part 2: The Best Laid Plans...

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Onslaught plays mind games with X-Force! The team is scattered in telepathic planes, or trapped in the rubble of Xavier’s mansion. What is reality and what is artificial reality becomes confused, as each member re-lives the darkest time of their life, or sees their greatest fear realized.
name: Onslaught Impact 2: ...Before the Dawn

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
With Shatterstar's identity in question, Cable interrogates him, as the rest of the team watches, expressing a wide variety of views on the proceedings.  The session ends with the return of Rictor, who had quit X-Force some time ago.   
The team soon embarks on a mission to trace Shatterstar's past as Warpath frets over the disappearance of Risque.  Cable makes a stop to meet with NYPD Detective Charlotte Jones, who informs him the files on X-Force and on Benjamin Russell (Shatterstar's possible true identity) are missing.   
X-Force arrives at an asylum (where Shatterstar first learned about the discrepancy about his past) in Rutland, Vermont, only to find the building empty.  They again take off in Cable's Pacrat where they are attacked by Gog and Magog from the Mojoverse.  They abduct Shatterstar, then teleport to their home dimension with Cable on their heels. 
The Pacrat, severly damaged by the intrusion, plunges groundward, then abruptly rights itself.  Puzzled, the team reaches the cockpit to find Longshot casually sitting at the controls.
name: Are You Now or Have You Ever Been?

description:
In the Mojoverse, Cable and Shatterstar have been captured, and are being tortured by Mojo, Gog and Magog.
Back on Earth, the rest of X-Force, led by Longshot, call on Dr. Strange for aid in getting to Mojo's dimension.  At the same time, in Florida,  Risqué is confronted by the Blob, the Mimic and a shadowy figure. 
On Mojoworld, Cable and Shatterstar are forced to watch video of a future war, when 'Star kills Mojo.  Cable breaks free of his bonds, but Spiral materializes to oppose him.  Nearby, Longshot and X-Force teleport into the Mojoverse, relieved to find themselves in the midst of Dazzler's rebel troops.  The combined fighting force make their way into Mojo's palace, only to find it deserted.  They come upon a television monitor within which, they learn, Cable and Shatterstar have been "digitized".  Longshot states the two cannot long survive in that form. 
Meanwhile, in Rutland, Mojo has made his way to Earth, where he commences broadcasting his hypnotic programming to the local residents.
name: I Know You Are but What am I?

description:
On Earth, the entranced residents of Rutland, Vermont, watch Mojo's video of future war starring Cable and Shatterstar.  As X-Force also views the program from Mojoworld, they witness Shatterstar's death scene.  Spiral materializes and explains that Mojo's plan to siphon energy from Earth run counter to her wishes, so she offers to aid X-Force in rescuing Cable and Shatterstar.  Spiral teleports Siryn, Longshot and herself into the video battlefield, leaving Meltdown, Rictor, Caliban and Sunspot to face Gog, Magog and Mojo's troops.  As a horrified Mojo watches the broadcast from Earth, Spiral teleports the heroes to the Weisman Institute, a Rutland asylum with a link to Shatterstar's past. 
Inside, they find Benjamin Russell, a young man who fell into a coma when his mutant powers manifested.  Longshot transfers the soul from Shatterstar's dying form to Russell's body.  Russell/Shatterstar revives, feeling whole, just as Mojo begins to materialize.  Spiral shifts them all between dimensions, from where Longshot can order Caliban to destroy Mojo's digitizing television monitor.  Caliban does so, trapping Mojo between dimensions, while Spiral brings the rest to Mojoworld.  Unbeknownst to X-Force, the Gamesmaster gleefully views these events from afar.
name: Ask Me No More Questions and I'll Tell You No More Lies

description:
In Shinobi Shaw's laboratory, his scientists are developing a device to remove mutant genes, which they test upon Nga Coy Manh. As they watch the device fail, alarms warn of intruders, and Shaw dispatches his bodyguards, Clear-Cut and Mindmeld. The duo confront Caliban, Sunspot, Meltdown, Domino and Shatterstar. The fight ends quickly when Mindmeld sends Dom's consciousness into Caliban, and Meltdown's into Sunspot. Noticed only by Domino/Caliban, Clear-Cut secrets a key on her unconscious form.

While X-Force is held captive, Shaw summons Spiral to spirit away Nga and her twin brother Leong. Domino retrieves the hidden key, frees her teammates, and leads an attack. With the aid of Clear-Cut, who is working against Shaw, X-Force defeats Shaw and destroys the lab.
name: Human Nature

description:
Meltdown awakens in a seemingly deserted town called Liddleville, with no memory of how she got there.  She meets one living person, Dimitri Fortunov, who woke up in Liddleville himself a week earlier.  When Dimitri mentions Castle Doom, she begins to piece together recent events, which she relates to him:  X-Force met with Nathaniel Richards on a mission to disable the Time Platform belonging to the missing Dr. Doom.  At the castle gates, the team (Cable, Shatterstar, Siryn, Meltdown and Rictor) was confronted by Doom's guardian robots, the Servitors.  Each handled the automatons in his own way, but Meltdown fell through a trap door and was knocked out by another Servitor.  Her tale done, they soon look up to find a gigantic Cable looming over the town. 
At the same time, the members of X-Force left in reserve at a nearby gypsy camp, Sunspot, Warpath and Caliban, meet Sofia, a gypsy girl.  Warpath offers to lend her a CD, but when their fingers meet, Sofia collapses. 
Back at the keep, Cable and Richards release Meltdown and Dimitri from the device that transmitted their minds into the puppets of the miniture town.  Dimitri explains that he is the grandson of the baron Doom deposed to rule Latveria.  Suddenly, G. W. Bridge and two S.H.I.E.L.D. agents burst in, claiming the castle is under the jurisdiction of the U.N.  Not wanting to lose the castle he believes is his birthright, Dimitri attempts to toss a grenade, but is stunned by one of the agents, and falls against a control panel.  The Time Platform activates amid a burst of energy. 
At the gypsy camp, the leader, Esmerelda, explains Sofia collapsed after seeing a vision of Warpath's future.  Then, Esmerelda's son, Oskar, runs to inform them Castle Doom has just vanished.
name: Wish You Were Here

description:
In Latveria, Castle Doom has vanished, and Sunspot, Warpath and Caliban wonder where their teammates are. 
The rest of X-Force (Cable, Shatterstar, Siryn, Meltdown and Rictor, accompanied by Nathaniel Richards, Dimitri Fortunov, G. W. Bridge and two S.H.I.E.L.D. agents) determine that Dr. Doom's Time Platform has transported the entire castle back to 1941.  They learn that Baron Sabbat (Latveria's ruler and Dimitri's grandfather) has agreed to host Baron Strucker and his scientists in exchange for being left alone by Nazi Germany.  Strucker is attempting to build a device called the Storm-Catcher designed to collect cosmic energy.  The heroes also discover that they are mostly physically insubstantial, and some occupants see them as ghosts. 
Cable and Richards surmise that the Storm-Catcher is interfering with the Time Platform, preventing their return to the present.  When the Nazis reveal their intention to kill the Baron and take over Latveria, Shatterstar, Meltdown and Dimitri go to the rescue, while Siryn and Rictor attack Strucker and destroy the Storm-Catcher.  Cable activates the Platform, returning X-Force, their companions and the Castle back to the present. 
Despite Bridge's protests, Cable disables the Platform.  Bridge threatens to arrest Cable, but backs down in deference to their past.  Meanwhile, Richards broods about some future conflict with Cable.
name: The Haunting of Castle Doom

description:
While swimming in Breakstone Lake of Xavier's estate, James Proudstar is pleasantly surprised by Risqué‘s appearance.  Later, in James' quarters, they kiss, and are seen by Theresa Rourke, who becomes emotionally confused. 
That evening, James and Risqué go to a nightclub in 's , where one patron recognizes her and runs out in a panic.  James asks Luis, Risqué’s bartender friend, about her background, but Luis doesn't know much more than James does. 
Back at Xavier's, members of X-Force overhear Caliban playing Chopin on the piano, but this ends when he inexplicably collapses. 
Back at the night club, the Blob and the Mimic show up, intending to abduct James, but he and Risqué overcome the duo. 
Retiring to a friend's apartment, Risqué drugs James and he passes out.
name: Lower East Side Story

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
A blast from the past: Dani Moonstar is back! But is she friend or foe?

The Mutant Liberation Front has taken over a cancer research center in St. Louis, based on a tip that mutant-specific viruses are being developed there. Outside, a Zero Tolerance force surrounds the clinic.

Inside, Wildside doesn't accept his tip was wrong and Locus teleports, leaving the MLF for good.

The ZT commander, Ekatarina Gryaznova, allows a news crew into the research center, knowing full well they are really Domino, Sunspot and Siryn in disguise and are heading into a trap.

At the Xavier Institute, Cable discusses Caliban's recent seizures with him.

Outside the research center, the Zero Tolerance force captures Meltdown, Shatterstar and Rictor, while inside, three of the hostage researchers revel themselves as Prime Sentinels.

Back at Xavier's, Ozymandias visits a sleeping Caliban, musing about Apocalypse's plans for the former Morlock.
name: Stand-Off

description:
Domino is wanted dead or alive! And Warpath ventures into the unknown!

In the lab of a St. Louis cancer research center taken over by the Mutant Liberation Front, MLF members Dragoness, Moonstar, and Forearm join X-Force members Siryn, Sunspot and Domino against Zero Tolerance Prime Sentinels, in spite of Moonstar's revelation that she infiltrated the terrorist group as a S.H.I.E.L.D. agent. Domino volunteers to stay to detonate an explosive, allowing the others to escape through the top of the building.

Returning to the news van they used as a cover, Siryn and Sunpot find that Rictor, Meltdown, and Shatterstar are missing, probably captured by Zero Tolerance. Inside, ZT operative Ekatarina Gryaznova and her team take Wildside, Tempo and Dragoness in custody, as well as the unconscious Domino.

In his Detroit warehouse, Sledge turns off the TV, having watched news reports on Zero Tolerance activities, then prepares James Proudstar for a mission to another dimension to locate a "friend" of Sledge, in return for which James wants the address of Michael Whitecloud, the only other survivor of James' tribe.

Back in St. Louis, Forearm feels betrayed by Moonstar and departs, while nearby, Gryaznova reports to Bastion on the capture, but falsely adds that Domino escaped.

Later, holding her captive, Gryaznova reviews Dom's history, which Domino claims is mostly wrong. Gryaznova then reveals the reason behind her personal vendetta: on a mission three years earlier in El Salvador, Domino destroyed a robot cybernetically controlled by Gryaznova, putting her in a coma, from which she woke up transformed into a Prime Sentinel.

Later still, Domino finds herself strapped to an operating table, about to be anaesthetized.
name: Girl Talk

description:
This issue features the Vanisher! And a Zero Tolerance transport carries it's mutant prisoners to an unknown location...

Domino comes to somewhere in Oklahoma, with her hair shorn and a surgery scar on the back of her neck. She is aided by Spencer, a trucker who barely avoids running her over.

On a New Mexico highway, a Zero Tolerance convoy is transporting Shatterstar, Meltdown and Rictor to their base.

In Missouri, Sunspot, Siryn and Moonstar contact G. W. Bridge to ask if S.H.I.E.L.D. can get a fix on the locations of their captive teammates.

In the tunnels beneath the Xavier Institute, Cable and Caliban hide from the ZT force that has taken over the mansion.

Within his high-tech warehouse in Detroit, Sledge loses contact with Warpath, who is in a parallel dimension, searching for Sledge's "friend".

New Mexico: ZT commander Ekatarina Gryaznova makes an unauthorized stop to meet with three scientists who had formerly worked for Gideon, and intend to continue their experiments on the captive mutants.

The parallel dimension: James finds a being (appearing in the form of his childhood pet cat), who leads him to the one he seeks, the Vanisher. He is found telling stories to a crowd of creatures resembling cartoon dogs. When James tells the Vanisher he's here to get him back to Earth, the 'dogs' turn vicious.

New Mexico: Having found their teammates with S.H.I.E.L.D.'s aid, Siryn Sunspot and Moonstar attack and defeat Gryaznova, while the three scientists make their getaway.

At a diner in Oklahoma, Domino has no luck contacting any of her allies, and rejoins Spencer at the coffee counter, revenge on her mind.
name: Roadside Attractions

description:
The X-Force is on the road following Cable to his safehouse! But could a disagreement break up the gang forever?

On a New Mexico highway, Siryn, Sunspot and Moonstar release Meltdown, Shatterstar and Rictor from the Zeto Tolerance truck in which they've been held captive.

In the tunnel beneath the Xavier Institute, Ozymandias plants a memory in Cable's mind that Caliban is safe with an ally, when, in fact, he is there to collect Caliban for Apocalypse.

In the parallel dimension where he has found the Vanisher, Warpath is set upon by the pack of cartoon-like 'dogs'. The creatures become docile when, at Vanisher's suggestion, James begins to tell them a story.

With S.H.I.E.L.D.'s aid, X-Force finds and retrieves Domino from an Oklahoma diner, but before she leaves, she thanks the trucker, Spencer, for his help. As the team flies away, they encounter another aircraft, piloted, as it turns out, by Cable.

They all make it Cable's safehouse in North Carolina, where Domino, unsure of her place in X-Force, takes her leave. Later, inside the cabin, Cable explains his plan for X-Force to lay low with false identities. The team declines, opting to trust Cable's past training in making their way through the uncertain future. Cable accepts their decision, then he departs.
name: Transitions

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
Having picked up James Proudstar in Detroit, the X-Forcers are now in Ohio dealing with a broken down car.  Repairs require the team to stay the night in the town of Minerva.   They soon run into money troubles when Roberto DaCosta learns his trust fund account is frozen.
In Langley, Virginia, Domino learns from her doctor Rebecca Schuyler that the device implanted in her neck is inhibiting her neural system, but cannot be removed without permanent damage.  Meanwhile, Deadpool sneaks into the Xavier Institute looking for Theresa Rourke. 
Once the team in Minerva is settled into a cheap motel, James relates how he found the Vanisher in the other dimension and returned to Earth, where Sledge provided him with the address of Michael Whitecloud.  They hear a ruckus outside and look to see two mobsters trying to abduct a young man.  The mutants scare off the thugs, and their intended victim, Richie Alegria, offers them a job.
name: Destination: Unknown

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
In a fancy Chicago hotel, Richie Alegria holds a meeting between himself, his new bodyguards, Dani Moonstar, Bobby DaCosta and Tabitha Smith and the mobsters that are after him.  But the mutants learn that Richie is not being shaken down by the mob, as he claimed, but instead owes them the balance on a loan.  The mobsters give Richie two weeks to provide a return on their "investment".  Feeling betrayed, the mutants quit, but reluctantly stay with Richie when he explains he's a filmmaker working on a movie, and begs for their help.  
In a Washington, D.C. bank, Domino accesses a safe deposit box, then walks into the middle of a robbery.  With her powers off kilter due to the device implanted in her neck, she ponders her next move.
Theresa Rourke and James Proudstar find the reporter Michael Whitecloud living drunk and scared in a squalid apartment in Salvation, Nebraska.  Whitecloud explains the story behind James' tribe's massacre: he met Lucius DeWitt, a whistleblower exposing Project: Stepladder, an experimental genetics program acting on unsuspecting humans.  The Project's superiors tracked DeWitt to the tribe's Camp Verde and sent a Death Squad to eliminate everyone.  Whitecloud's been in hiding ever since.  He tells James of a bus station locker where the evidence is hidden, but before the reporter can name those behind the project, his head explodes. 
Later, an agent named Martin Edwards follows James and Theresa's trail. 
In Minerva, Ohio, a mysterious figure seeks Bobby and the others.
name: Lies and Deception

description:
James Proudstar and Theresa Rourke make their way to Topeka, Kansas, evading cops along the way. They are trying to obtain evidence, hidden in a bus station locker, regarding those behind the Camp Verde massacre.

In Washington, D.C., police examine video of a bank robbery foiled by a mystery woman (Domino).

In Topeka, as soon as James and Theresa obtain the packet of evidence, they are confronted by Martin Edwards, who is actually the lycanthropic Edwin Martynec. Martynec drugs and captures the pair.

The rest of X-Force are currently in Memphis, Tennessee, still accompnying scheming filmmaker Richie Alegria. In Chicago, a mystrious figure on the trail of the mutants has started a blaze in the hotel where the team recently stayed.

Somewhere in Arkansas, James and Theresa come to, finding themselves about to be experimented on by Martynec, who reveals that Project: Stepladder and the Camp Verde massacre were the handiwork of Stryfe. Theresa breaks free, releases James, and a fight ensues. Martynec injects James with an amphetamine compund the accelerates his heartrate to deadly levels, then Theresa hits Martynec with a bone-shattering sonic scream. As she tries to aid him, James' heart stops.
name: Stop Motion

description:
James Proudstar is dead, and his spirit now exists in a hellish realm where he is confronted by Stryfe.  On the mortal plane, in Arkansas, Theresa Rourke tries in vain to revive James. 
Outside a saloon in Missouri, Dani Moonstar and her allies are visited by the Valkyrie, Brunnhilde, who bears the news of James' peril.  The warrior opens a portal for Dani, Bobby DaCosta and Tabitha Smith to go to James' aid.  They leave behind their new friend, Richie Alegria, who is found by the mobsters he's been running from.  However, the thugs are killed by a mysterious figure who wields power similar to Sunspot's. 
In the Underworld, as the spirits of James and Stryfe fight, the realm's ruler, Blackheart, makes his presence known.  When Moonstar, Sunspot and Meltdown arrive, Blackstar confronts them with their deepest fears.  James' soul then finds the will to beat down Stryfe, and return to his body, bringing his teammates along as well.
name: Afterlife

description:
After their recent near-death experience, X-force attends the "Exploding Colossal Man" gathering in Texas (styled after Nevada's "Burning Man") for some R and R, and run into Xi'an Coy Manh sporting a punky new look.  Taking advantage of the downtime, the various members discuss the things on their minds.  James Proudstar tells Theresa Rourke that with the end of his quest to find out who was responsible for the massacre of his tribe, he doesn't know what direction his life should take.  The friendship between Roberto Dacosta and Tabitha Smith begins to grow into something more.  Dani Moonstar tells Xi'an she's unsure if she belongs with X-Force.   The team are spied upon by Locus and Reignfire, but they leave without incident.
Later, Dani brings forth an illusion for James in which he meets with the deceased members of his family, allowing him to bid them farewell.  At that point, the sorceress Selene makes her presence known, stunning James with an earthen fist to his jaw.  She is there to find the means to unlock a mystic box containing the Runestaff forged from the life tree Yggdrasil and using its power to challenge the world.  Since only the blood of an Asgardian can release the Runestaff, Selene immobilizes Dani, who was once a Valkyrie, and cuts her.  The drops of Dani's blood cause the box to open, and Selene grasps the staff, reveling in its power.  
Dani exerts what little power she can and revives James, who releases her from the earthen shell in which she's encased.  With a psychic arrow, Dani dislodges the Runestaff from Selene's hand, and its energies carry it to the Colossal Man structure where it becomes lodged in the framework.  As Sam Guthrie catches up with Tabitha and Roberto, the Colossal Man comes to life and strides through the crowd.  The heretofore hidden Cable, who has been covertly watching his former charges, nearly goes into action, but X-Force and their allies rise to the occasion: Xi'an controls the crowd to avoid a panic while James Theresa, Roberto and Sam use their powers to tackle the Colossal Man.  Meanwhile, Dani and Selene fight, until Dani summons an illusion of Selene as an aged crone, forcing the sorceress to flee.  
James climbs the structure and removes the Runestaff, then Tabitha hurls time-bombs into the Colossal Man, and it goes up in flames.  They return the staff to its container, and eventually the festival comes to its close.
name: Convergence

description:
The members of X-Force, along with Sam Guthrie, continue to enjoy their down-time at a bowling alley in West Nathan, Texas.  Their games come to an end, however, when Tabitha Smith uses her mutant power of creating minor explosive charges to liven things up, eliciting scowls from the other alley patrons.  As they depart, Roberto Dacosta and Tabitha quietly discuss how to handle their possible attraction to each other, and whether or not to tell Sam, Tabitha's boyfriend, that she and Roberto shared a kiss.
Meanwhile, aboard an empty oil tanker in the Gulf of Mexico, the de-powered Domino fights a series of battles against super-powered opponents.  Her purpose is two-fold: to earn position as bodyguard for international crime-lord Etienne Rousseau, and more importantly to her, to prove to herself she still has what it takes to survive in her world of intrigue.  Domino defeats her latest opponent, Snakeskin, and before long, Arcade, the organizer of the competition, introduces her next foe: Shatterstar.  'Star expresses his regrets to Domino, but he is forced by Arcade to fight her in order to save his friend, Julio Richter, from the assassin's deathtrap.  Julio is captive in a cell surrounded by globes filled with nitroglycerin, preventing him from using his powers as Rictor to free himself.
The fight commences, and although Shatterstar inflicts a few flesh wounds, Domino perseveres and emerges triumphant, knocking 'Star out.  Arcade and Rousseau enter, and Domino decapitates Arcade with one of Shatterstar's swords.  This Arcade is revealed to be merely a robot.  When Rousseau offers Dom the bodyguard position, however, she takes him into custody, fulfilling her true assignment, the crime-lord's arrest.  As Shatterstar recovers, Arcade watches the events on screen, accompanied by Mojo, who reiterates his claim of owning 'Star.
Back in Texas, most of the gang prepares to make a food run, with Roberto and Tabitha staying behind in their motel room.  Thinking the others are gone, they embrace and kiss.  Returning for his forgotten wallet, Sam discovers the pair.  Furious, he turns and blasts off, leaving his friends.
name: Bittersweet Reunions

description:
In an old shack in the town of Almost Reno, New Mexico, two young children, Johnny and Mary, confide in each other they have mutant powers. Later, Johnny’s burned body is found by the local sheriff, but is soon claimed by two S.H.I.E.L.D. agents.

X-Force continues their cross-country trip. Having a meal at a diner in Almost Reno, are Bobby DaCosta (Sunspot), James Proudstar (Warpath), Tabitha Smith (Meltdown) and Dani Moonstar. Team leader Theresa Rourke (Siryn) sits in their car, trying to figure out where she got them lost. Dani reads a newspaper story about Johnny, and, despite the unfriendly attitudes of the townspeople, X-Force decides to look into the matter. Bobby and Tab try to learn about the town’s background at a library, while Theresa, James and Dani check out the site where the boy’s body was found. The three suffer a psychic attack until Theresa finds the source: Mary, who has been missing since her mother took her to the doctor, where she overheard their thoughts, frightening her.

Six S.H.I.E.L.D. agents show up to take the girl, and Dani generates a psychic arrow, trying to force them to back off. Mary, however, unleashes a massive psychic blast, stunning everyone. She runs away again.

At the sheriff’s office, X-Force learns from Briggs, the lead S.H.I.E.L.D. agent, that much of the town’s populace had been accidentally exposed to atomic radiation from nearby testing. He explains their assignment is to monitor the mutant children that had been born since then.

Outside, Tabitha begins to confide in Bobby about her past. She had been bullied at school and abused by her father at home. Tab cuts the talk short and walks toward a playground, soon followed by her teammates. There, she sees Mary on a swing, and she joins her while the others watch from a distance. Tab reassures Mary, demonstrating her own power generating small ‘time bombs’, but S.H.I.E.L.D. agents begin to surround the swing set. More confident in her abilities, Mary induces the agents to suffer headaches and nosebleeds, just as her relieved mother runs up to embrace her. Mary and Tabitha give each other a ‘thumbs up’. Soon, X-Force is back on the road, resuming their cross-country trip.
name: City of Lost Children

description:
The home of DaCosta International CEO Getulio Villa-Lobos in Sao Paolo, Brazil, is invaded by Reignfire and Locus. After Locus sends the businessman’s bodyguards through her teleportaion portals, Reignfire terrorizes Villa-Lobos. Those familiar with Reignfire believe him to be Roberto (Bobby) DaCosta, aka Sunspot of X-Force, but the villain states that while he, in truth, in not Roberto, he is determined to take all that belongs to Roberto, including the company.

Elsewhere, Tabitha Smith (Meltdown) has a dream in which she is on a TV talk show defending her relationship with Bobby, while dealing with the fact she betrayed Sam Guthrie, her previous boyfriend. She wakes from the nightmare in the Boulder, Colorado apartment of Sally Blevins, whom Tab has known since they were both members of the New Mutants. Currently, Sally is a college student who no longer wants to be involved in super-heroics, and has rejected her former codename ‘Skids’. She does, however, allow Tab and her X-Force teammates Bobby, Theresa Rourke (Siryn) and James Proudstar (Warpath) to spend a few nights at her home during her friends’ cross-country road trip.

Tab and Sally, who has just returned from a Chemistry class exam, discuss their past, Sally explaining she no longer wants to risk her life at the whim of any mutant mentor, and that she desperately misses her friend, Rusty Collins, who was killed by Holocaust.

Bobby wakes up and heads to the bathroom where someone is showering. Thinking it’s Tab, he pulls open the curtain to surprise her, but instead finds a startled and angry Theresa. The group then meet Sally’s roommate, Desmond Hatori, who’s there to check out the commotion. Theresa feels an immediate attraction to Des, but in embarassment, remembers she’s

wearing only a towel.

The remaining member of X-Force, Danielle Moonstar, has opted to visit her family’s Colorado ranch. While helping her father with chores, she is attacked and abducted by Reignfire.

Later, Bobby and Tab roam the college campus. They part after a brief spat, and Bobby comes across an informal soccer game, which he’s invited to join in on. At the same time, Theresa and James enjoy drinks at a nearby hangout, where they are joined by Des. Their chat, however, is interrupted when Locus snatches Theresa through her portal. Before it fully closes, James leaps through it after them.

At the soccer game, a student Bobby is playing alongside suddenly bursts into flame and dies, a victim of Reignfire, who has come to abduct Sunspot.

Sally finds Tabitha, who is brooding about the spat, when their attention is caught by flame erupting on the quad where Bobby was playing. They rush toward the scene, and, despite Sally’s protests, Tab attacks Reignfire. She succumbs to the villain’s heat, then is rescued by Sally, who is upset about being forced to use her power in public. Then, Locus appears, knocks out Sally and Tab, and draws them back through her portal. Locus then returns to teleport Reignfire and Bobby to Las Vegas.

There, within an unfinished, abandoned hotel/casino, they have X-Force bound and suspended by their feet, except Bobby, whom they strap to an alter. As Reignfire boasts about being the cause of Bobby’s recent troubles (primarily, the lawsuit that froze Bobby’s assets), James, his presence unknown to the two villains, hides in the shadows, planning the rescue of his team.
name: Burning Desires

description:
Dr. Segismund Joshua, a research scientist at the Damocles Foundation, headquartered in Portland, Oregon, retrieves from the installation’s armory a molecular disruptor. He then informs a colleague he is taking personal time off, and is going to Las Vegas.

In the heart of the gambling Mecca, within an unfinished abandoned hotel/casino, Reignfire gloats over his captives, the young mutants of X-Force: Theresa Rourke (Siryn), Danielle Moonstar, Tabitha Smith (Meltdown) and Roberto ‘Bobby’ DaCosta (Sunspot), along with their former teammate, Sally Blevins (once called ‘Skids’). The four girls are bound and suspended by their ankles, while Bobby is chained to a dais. Reignfire’s ally, Locus, tells the five they’ll soon die. Unaccounted for by the villains is the remaining member of X-Force, James Proudstar (Warpath), who managed to leap unseen through Locus’ portal in Boulder, Colorado.

As James tries to concoct a rescue plan, Tabitha manages to break a weak link in her chains, but she finds she’s unable to use her mutant ability to generate ‘time bombs’. Likewise, all the mutants’ powers are dampened by the presence of Henry Wallinger, a simple-minded mutant with power-cancelling abilities. Locus calls him Short Circuit.

Bobby demands to know who Reignfire is and why he intends to kill them. Reignfire commences to explain their relationship: Reignfire and Bobby shared a telepathic bond, allowing the villain to control Bobby’s thoughts and actions, forcing him to masquerade as Reignfire, leading the Mutant Liberation Front, and to later unmask in front of X-Force. Locus and Reignfire fed the mutant heroes a set of believeable lies, and when Cable thought he had telepathically excised Reignfire’s persona from Bobby’s mind, he had merely severed their link, leaving Reignfire dazed for months.

Meanwhile, Dr. Joshua speeds down a Nevada highway. He recalls events of two years prior, when he was assigned by Gideon to use the captive Roberto DaCosta as an experimental subject. Joshua attempted to transfer genetic material gathered from Bobby to another mutant Joshua had designated Project Nineteen. Nineteen’s physical form had been deteriorating until blood taken from Bobby reversed the illness.

At the casino, Reignfire is draining the rest of Bobby’s powers, drawing them into himself. James makes his move, toppling a statue onto Locus and Short Circuit. Locus recovers and attacks James, intenting to decapitate his with her portal, but with Short Circuit unconscious, Sally’s power of frictionlessness returns and she slips her bonds. She tackles Locus, who tries to retaliate, but their respective powers disrupt each other, and the pair end up unconscious in a distant mountain range.

The rest of the team free themselves and take on Reignfire, but he sets the building on fire. Tab, Dani and James (carrying Short Circuit) escape through a hole Tabitha blasts in the floor, while Theresa hauls Bobby up and out through the roof. Reignfire follows and continues the fight on Fremont Street in downtown Las Vegas. Dr. Joshua, who has reached the scene, fires his molecular disruptor at the villain, severely hurting him. Reignfire retaliates by burning Joshua. Bobby finds the geneticist, briefly confronting him before picking up the weapon, and firing it at Reignfire.

The disruptor destroys Reignfire’s physical form, leaving him an ectoplasmic mass. Bobby eases up on the trigger, and Reignfire takes the opportunity to enter Bobby’s body, gaining full control.
name: Set My Soul on Fire

description:
X-Force is vacationing on a Hawaii beach. Bobby DaCosta (Sunspot) and Tabitha Smith (Meltdown) try out tandem surfing. They wipe out and while Tab is under the surface, she sees several creatures with tiki masks marching on the seabed. By the time she gets Bobby and James Proudstar to come look, the things have gone.

Later, the team enjoys a luau, and as James admires the sunset, he sees a familiar figure, Risque. He confronts her about her betrayal of him, and turns his back on her when one of the creatures seen by earlier by Tabitha emerges from the shore intending to abduct Risque. The pair run, but Krotok, as the beast calls himself, not wanting to be seen by humans, returns to the water.

To his teammates' dismay, James brings Risque back with him to the luau. Risqué explains she, along with Sledge and the Vanisher, came to purloin a mystic artifact called the Heart of Pele (the Hawaiian volcano goddess), which is also being sought by a faction of Lava Men. Risque and the Vanisher evaded the Lava Men, but Sledge was caught by them. Apparently, its theft has caused an increase in volcanic activity. Risqué states that if the heart is not returned, a cataclysm could ensue. Warily, X-Force agree to help.

Risqué leads the team to a cave within the Kilauea Caldera, where they find Sledge in the company of Lava Men. Sledge explains that a cave-in separated the trio and Vanisher made off with the stone. Jinku, the high priest and leader of the Lava Men, demands the return of the Heart of Pele, and he threatens the group. Risque offers X-Force's aid in retrieving the stone, but Jinku agrees to allow two members to leave while the rest remain in the cave. Sledge tells Theresa Rourke (Siryn) and Bobby they will likely find the Vanisher at a particular hotel on Maui.

They find the thief at the hotel's pool, and since he's never met Theresa, she makes a plan to take him unawares. She walks by Vanisher, flirting with him. When he approaches her, and she leans in under the pretense of whispering into his ear. Instead, she stuns him with a sonic blast, allowing Bobby to grab him before he would be able to teleport.

Soon, Theresa and Bobby are back at the cave handing the Heart of Pele to Ginku. The priest then announces his intent to use it to power a continent-leveling weapon called the Firebringer in order to destroy the surface world. The team goes on the attack and Theresa grabs the Heart. Risque tells her to give it Bobby, the only one of them that can return the stone to where it belongs. By this point, Dani Moonstar surmises the woman is not Risque, and indeed, she reveals herself to be the goddess Pele. She had taken Risque's form after the theft, leaving the real Risque safe in an enchanted sleep, in order to guide X-Force to aid the goddess. At Pele's direction, Bobby dives into the magma of the volcano to deposit the stone, making Pele whole again. In return, Pele ensures that X-Force enjoys the rest of their vacation uninterrupted.

[Mote: This issue ncludes a poster of Adam Pollina's sketch of X-Force commemorates his run on the series.]
name: Hot Lava

description:
Within the Aguilar Institute, a heavily fortified facility in northern California, armored guards present to a woman called Gryphon a catpured intruder: an unconscious Domino.
Meanwhile, in San Francisco, the members of X-Force return from an evening out to their warehouse headquarters to discover an intruder of their own.  Jesse Aaronson, a mutant with the ability to disrupt electrical equipment, had broken in to await the arrival of the team.  As X-Force prepares to confront the invader, he explains he's there to enlist their aid in rescuing their former teammate Domino from the Aguilar Institute.  Jesse goes on to say he has access to data about the members of X-Force, and was aware that Domino was searching for Ekatarina Gryaznova, the Zero Tolerance Prime Sentinel who had briefly imprisoned Domino.  He had made a deal with Dom, offering to lead her to Gryaznov, if she'd help find his missing brother.
Some time later, Jesse and Domino were outside the Aguilar Institute, but were discovered by guards wearing smart armor that could adjust to their adversaries' abilities.  Jesse escaped, but Dom was captured.
At the facility, Domino sits within a force field chamber, as Gryphon makes her entrance.  Dom recognizes her as a mutated Ekaterina Gryaznova, altered by Bastion's nanotechnology when he discovered her betrayal of him.
Outside, X-Force and Jesse approach in a helicopter which comes under attack by armored guards.  They leap from the chopper and fight their way to the complex.  Using his abilities, Jesse makes it into the building, soon finding Domino and releasing her from the force field.  Having learned from X-Force that a power-inhibiting device was implanted in Domino's head, Jesse disrupts it before she can warn him not to, and she falls unconscious.
Gryphon discovers Jesse and takes him on, easily overpowering the youth.  Domino recovers, and, with the inhibitor deactivated, attacks Gryphon, stunning her with a live electrical cable.  
Gryphon, fearing defeat and exposure of the Institute's purpose, activates a self-destruct device.  X-Force makes their timely entrance, rescuing Domino and Jesse moments before the building explodes.  Soon, the teammates are reveling in their reunion.
Elsewhere, two unseen men discuss someone named 'Bedlam', who has been located in San Francisco, saying they are determined to "bring him back".
name: The Gryphon Agnda

description:
While visiting his sick mother in his hometown of Cumberland, Kentucky, Sam Guthrie (Cannonball) has encountered Ulysses Bloodstone (a Deviant) and Arcadia, two super-powered individuals who are on the run from a Deviant team of hunters called the Sword. As Sam, Ulysses and Arcadia hide in an abandoned house, their pursuers (Argos, Pyre Stranglehold and Zona) close in on them. The trio prepare to defend themselves, but Arcadia has lifted Sam's wallet, within which she finds a photo of his friends in X-Force. She asks if they're mutants like he is and why isn't he summoning them.

In the San Francisco warehouse headquarters of X-Force, the team express their wariness about allowing Jesse Aronson to stay with them, his former caretakers from the mutant protection agency called M.U.S.E. having accepted the boy's decision not to return. As the discussion gets heated, Siryn, Sunspot, Meltdown, Moonstar and James Proudstar suddenly disappear, as the startled Jesse and Domino look on.

To Ulysses' dismay, Arcadia has used her reality-warping powers to teleport X-Force to Cumberland to back Cannonball up against the Sword. The battle is joined; Zona zaps James and when Moonstar comes to his aid, she feels the backlash of the Psi-War that had debilitated Earth's psi-sensitive individuals. Cannonball saves Meltdown from Stranglehold, but then they're taken out by Pyre. Argos disables Siryn, and Zona knocks out Sunspot. Having won the battle, the hunters resume their pursuit of Arcadia. Zona enters the shack where Ulysses grabs her by the neck. Pyre enters and blasts Ulysses' arm off to free her.

Outside, Cannonball and Meltdown recover, and she generates an explosive sphere which she tosses at Argos and Stranglehold's feet. It causes an underground septic tank to erupt, stunning the two hunters. They then enter the shack, Cannonball knocking Pyre out with Argos' staff and Meltdown taking out Zona. Arcadia uses her powers to crystalize Argos and Zona's bodies, intending to shatter them to end their threat. Moonstar steps up to stop her, but Arcadia alters Moonstar, making her sparkly and blue. The conflict ends when Ulysses uses his power to sedate Arcadia. Moonstar returns to normal.

The group puts the unconscious hunters aboard the Sword's own aircraft, then Ulysses and Arcadia take their leave. Sam and his teammates head toward his home.

Later, in New Mexico, Dr. Chandra of the Damocles Foundation reports to the apparent Deviant leader of the Sword. Upon hearing that his quarry have escaped with the help of X-Force, he states they should either recruit the team or eliminate them.
name: ...By the Sword

description:
In a dungeon in Latveria, Sally Blevins (once known as Skids) and a near-catatonic Locus meet their captor: a 700-year-old sorceress who calls herself Pandemonia. Sally tries to resist, but Pandemonia places her sigil on Sally's forehead enthralling her. The sorceress has been imprisoned there for six centuries, but now in Locus' teleportation power, she has a means of escape to begin a new reign of terror.

In X-Force's San Francisco warehouse headquarters, Tabitha Smith (Meltdown) thinks about Sally, and recalls the team's failed attempt to determine her whereabouts since Sally and Locus disappeared from Las Vegas. Her thoughts are interrupted by a crash outside her room, and she goes to investigate. Tab finds her teammates Bobby DaCosta (Sunspot), Theresa Rourke (Siryn), and James Proudstar, lying about in a daze, with a strange symbol on the foreheads, and Sally standing above them. At an unheard command, Bobby knocks Tab out, and Pandemonia enters.

After having spent a few hours at the beach, the remaining members of X-Force (Sam 'Cannonball' Guthrie, Dani Moonstar and Jesse 'Bedlam' Aaronson) return to the warehouse to find the interior has been transformed into a castle hall. Further inside, they discover the sorceress sitting on a throne, surrounded by their enthralled friends and Locus, all dressed in medieval garb. Pandemonia attacks the trio to put them under her spell, but discovers Dani is protected by the Mark of Asgard and thus, is untouchable. The witch commands her thralls to attack the three, but Sam grabs Dani and Jesse and launches himself and them out of the warehouse.

At a loss for how to battle a sorceress, the trio go to an occult shop, where they meet a customer named Benchly who offers assistance. That aid comes in the form of an address to a mansion where they go and meet Jennifer Kale, a mystic adept eager to help. Jesse describes the sigil on the foreheads of their teammates, and Jennifer soon identifies the witch as Pandemonia.

Soon, Cannonball bursts into the HQ, followed by Moonstar, Bedlam and Jennifer. The mutants take on their friends, and without warning Moonstar's form changes as it did recently in Kentucky. Finding the right moment, Jennifer recites a mystic incantation revealing the witch's true demonic form and releasing X-Force from her spells. Moonstar uses the new energies flowing through her body to attack Pandemonia, giving Jennifer an opening to expel the sorceress from the earthly plane. Refusing to express any gratitude for her rescue, Locus leaves though a teleportation portal. The team then turn their attention to Dani who has still not transformed back to her normal self.

Later, at a Los Angeles hospital, Domino asks a Dr. Leonard about the Aguilar Institute and in response is shown a patient: a bedridden young girl who transforms in to a scaly creature, then dies. Leonard tells Domino the girl is just one of several such children in a test group in the town of Almost Reno, New Mexico.
name: Possessed

description:
X-Force (Dani Moonstar, James Proudstar, Sunspot, Siryn, Meltdown, Domino, Cannonball, and Bedlam) return to the town of Almost Reno, New Mexico to check up on the super-powered children and to follow up on information Domino has gathered regarding the Aguilar Institute. They discover the town is deserted, except for a fiery being who lunges at them, blaming them for his condition. James strikes the assailant who collapses and dies. Domino checks the body and determines it had been a young teenage boy, and he died, not from James' blow, but from the heat-based mutation he suffered.

They split into two groups to explore the town. In a grocery store, Domino, Sunspot, Cannonball and Bedlam discover the owner frozen in the cooler, where he had probably hid when the townspeople vanished. Further along, in a gas station garage, they find sophisticated surveillance equipment which they surmise had been used to monitor the mutant children.

Meanwhile, at a diner, Siryn, Meltdown, Dani and James find Mary, the girl Tabitha (Meltdown) had befriended a few months earlier. With her is Zak, a boy who has grown muscular with a gray rocky hide. Tab gets Mary to relate what had happened: one of her classmates had started to glow, becoming too bright to look at, the all the children were sent home. It was then that S.H.I.E.L.D. agents stepped in and evacuated the town except for the few children that had gone into hiding.

When the exit the diner, they are confronted by a team of agents who demand Mary be turned over to them. Dani expresses her doubt that they are truly S.H.I.E.L.D., and when Meltdown refuses to give up the girl, they open fire on the mutants. Zak leaps in front of them taking all the shots, as Siryn levels the gunmen with a sonic boom. Moonstar uses her newfound abilities to ease Zak's wounds as well as the injurious mutation of his body. The rest of X-Force rushes back to help. Domino begins to interrogate one of the agents, who remains tight-lipped, but Mary reads his mind, telling the group his thoughts are about the Damocles Foundation.

Unexpectedly, a limousine pulls up, and from it exits an imposing figure who introduces himself as Odysseus Indigo, the Deviant leader of the Damocles Foundation. He also confirms he is the brother of Ulysses Dragonblood, whom the team met in Kentucky. Mary and Meltdown try to use their powers against him, but he exhibits the ability to neutralize their talents.

Indigo then explains his mission: atomic testing done near Almost Reno rendered the citizens of the town sterile, so the foundation stepped in offering genetic engineering as a solution to correct the reproductive damage. The result of these efforts was a generation of children born with a combination of mutant and Deviant genes, which, unfortunately, proved unstable and deadly to the children. Indigo had the town evacuated and the people put in quarantine until they could be safely relocated. Now, he wants Mary, who exhibits no instability, so he can have her examined in hopes of finding a way to breed a thriving new generation.

X-Force and Indigo come to an impasse, so he leaves, and the team begin to discuss their options.
name: Experimental Living

description:
Five years before the present, a promising student had interviewed with Emma Frost, but declined to enroll in her Massachusetts Academy. He had also successfully resisted her telepathic powers. Before he departed the campus, he bid farewell to Marie Ange Colbert (Tarot), an Academy student with whom he had shared a romantic relationship.

The Present: James Proudstar walks the San Francisco streets on a foggy night, when he feels the presence of another. He turns to confront the shade only to find it is his fellow former Hellion, Tarot, whom he’d thought dead. She delivers a dire warning of events that will befall X-Force: the awakening of a “sleeping giant” and betrayal from within. She then fades into the fog, leaving behind the Death card from a tartot deck.

In a bar elsewhere in town, Domino meets with Jesse Aaronson to convey information she has learned about his parents that may aid in his quest to find his long-lost brother, Christopher. His parents had been government security analysts, and Domino knows the whereabouts of Dabney Saunders, who had supervised them.

After Jesse takes a dose of his anti-anxiety medication, they travel to a retirement home in Sacramento. To their disappointment, Saunders is of no help, able to speak only a string of random words and phrases. However, Domino discovers his orderly making a call to someone, reporting the visit. She confronts him, demanding to know who’s on the other end.

At X-Force’s headquarters, Sam Guthrie (Cannonball) and Bobby DaCosta (Sunspot) engage in some demolition work, preparing to make the warehouse better suited to the team’s activities. Tabitha Smith (Meltdown) enters to inform Sam he has a phone call from his sister Paige. Paige is with their ailing mother in Kentucky, whom she lets Sam know is recovering well.

Later, Tabitha, in a dour mood, heads out for the evening, turning down Bobby’s offer of a date. Still, he follows her to a North Beach restaraunt where she meets her estranged father. After her father introduces his new wife (his fourth) and talks about being helped by an organization called the Triune Understanding, Tabitha loses her temper. Fed up with her father’s failed marriages and his devotion to a group she considers a cult, she storms out. Adding to her anger is her discovery that Bobby trailed her there.

Outside the city, sorceress Jennifer Kale observes Dani Moonstar using her newly acquired abilities. She tells Dani her new powers are not supernatural, but instead may be cosmic in nature.

Acting upon what the orderly admitted to her, Domino leads Jesse to a large vineyard house in Santa Lucia. After entering, they are confronted by former New Mutant Magma and Paradigm, a techno-organic being. Jesse uses his power to disrupt the entity, but then he and Domino succumb to a mind-numbing attack, and they collapse, spouting random words. The telepathic assailant enters, introducing himself as Jesse’s older brother, Christopher.

Christopher explains that after the accident that killed their parents, he was taken for study by Saunders, who had destroyed all records of his childhood. Christopher had escaped by using his disruptive telepathy, permanently damaging Saunders’ mind.

Finally, he bring forth his team: Magma, Paradigm, Tarot and another telepath named Switch, collectively known as the New Hellions.
name: Armageddon Now, Part One: Family Matters

description:
In the house located on his Santa Lucia, California, vineyard, Christopher Aaronson (King Bedlam), Jesse's older brother, welcomes the members of X-Force as his guests, and introduces his New Hellions (Magma, Tarot and Paradigm). Unseen by those present, a fifth member, Switch, awakens, disoriented, in the cellar. Christopher tries to assure X-Force that, other than the presence of Tarot, his group has no connection to the original Hellions, young mutants who were the pawns of the Inner Circle of the Hellfire Club. Cannonball questions Magma, his former teammate from their days as New Mutants, about her decision to be part of the New Hellions. She responds coldly and with disdain that her goals are less idealistic and more materialistic now.

Then, another Hellion, former X-Force member Feral, makes her presence known, openly hostile toward her former teammates, until king Bedlam reins her in. Tensions still rise, and Domino insists that her team listen to King Bedlam's proposal. He offers an alliance, stating that conflict among various mutant factions is self-defeating. Instead, they should be cooperating to change the world to one in which mutants can live out in the open without fear. If all mutantkind would unite is this goal, he insists, they could not be stopped. With that, the Hellions leave X-Force to retire for the night.

Instead, X-Force gather in the library to discuss the matter. Despite Domino's uncharacteristic suggestion that maybe they should stop policing other mutants, they opt to snoop around. James Proudstar, having been slipped a note from Tarot, meets with her, and again she warns him his team is in grave danger and that King Bedlam has something serious planned. James advises her to turn her back on Bedlam, but she refuses, saying she owes her rebirth and life to him. She departs and James faces Feral, who has been hidden in a tree, spying on them.

Jesse finds his brother in a warehouse on the grounds, where he is preparing a huge radiation chamber for transport. Jesse confronts Christopher, asking why he was asked to bring X-Force along, and what is it he has planned. Christopher replies he wants to keep his potential enemies close and shows Jesse that there is something of immense power within the unit. Finally, he tells his brother he must choose between friends and family.

X-Force regroup in the library to compare notes. Domino tells them she found explosives in the cellar which they should tend to. They are about to follow her lead, when Switch stumbles in, claiming to be Domino in the Hellion's body. Domino lunges at him, and Siryn lets loose a sonic scream which breaks Switch's hold, and reverts the pair to their true bodies.

X-Force go to confront the New Hellions, but between King Bedlam's brain-scrambling power and Paradigm's techno-organic tendrils, they're easily subdued. King Bedlam then prepares for the next part of his plan: transport of the containment unit to a nuclear power plant where he intends to revive the inhabitant of the container, an immensely powerful mutant he calls the Armageddon Man.
name: Armageddon Now, Part Two: Blood & Betrayal

description:
At the decommissioned Summerfield Canyon Nuclear Power Plant in central California, the members of X-Force, under control of the techno-organic being called Paradigm, set into place the radiation containment unit housing the Armageddon Man. The Armageddon Man, one of the earliest known mutants of the Atomic Age, has been kept in suspended animation since being struck down by an Army airstrike shortly after the emergence of his devastating powers, which uncontrollably generated massive natural disasters. Now, King Bedlam, after stealing the container and taking it to the plant, intends to reactivate the facility to generate the power necessary to revive the immensely destructive mutant.

Bedlam's younger brother, Jesse Aaronson, recently accepted by X-Force, expresses mixed emotions about the situation: shame for betraying his new friends, disappointment that his long-lost brother is far different than what he'd hoped he'd be, loyalty to his brother and horror at the imminent disasters to come if the Armageddon Man is awoken.

Bedlam dispatches Feral and Switch to abduct Senator Owen Danville, who in 1959 had commanded the troop-s that took down the Armageddon Man. At the Senator's home, Feral kills his bodyguard, and then Switch takes over his body.

While X-Force move the comatose mutant's body from its contaiher to the cooling chamber, Danielle Moonstar has unconsciously established a mind-link with paradigm, recalling his memories as if they were her own. As a child in Hong Kong, he had been held in a lab where researchers studied his talent of 'technokinesis', the ability to mentally manipulate machinery and electronics. In the last of their torturous experiments on the boy, they introduced a sample of an alien techno-organic virus into his system. His power and the virus clashed for dominance until, he mutated into an alien/human hybrid. With his new mutation, he killed his captors and escaped.

Upon the arrival of Feral, Switch and Danville at the plant, Bedlam's plan becomes clearer as he threatens to unleash the Armageddon Man unless the Senator can convince Congress to meet his demands for one billion dollars. Knowing what the entity is capable of, the Senator acquiesces to the blackmail.

After taking more of his anti-anxiety medicine, Jesse decides to leave, offering to let Tarot join him. Committed to Bedlam and resigned to the fate she's seen in her cards, she declines. Bedlam makes an attempt of stop Jesse, emphasizing their kinship, and Jesse lingers.

Not wanting the deaths of millions on her conscience, Tarot enters the reactor room to stop Paradigm, but, as she expected, he binds her with his techno-organic tendrils, allowing her to project her power through him. He becomes confused as phantasms based on various tarot cards spring from his form. Trying to purge himself, he releases his X-Force thralls, giving Moonstar the opportunity to use her newfound cosmic powers against him. Overwhelmed, he retreats, encasing himself in an egg-like shell.

Bedlam turns on Tarot for her interference, and Jesse comes to her defense. As they brawl, X-Force burst in, and Jesse unable to choose a side, stands idle. Suddenly, there is a tremendous rumble, as the gathered combatants realize the Armageddon Man has awakened.
name: Armageddon Now, Part Three: Hellions Triumphant!
